text:
I have problem using the record mode, because the proxy is using url-encoding 
for multipart/form-data.

This means that my data is changed before sending it to the backend webserver, 
(eg "+" is changed to " ") with as result that the backend webserver receives 
wrong data and is returning me an error.

So at this moment I cannot use any html request using the "content-Type: 
multipart/form-data" header. Which is especially used for uploading file etc.
creator: bart.dooms@ubizen.com

text:
I don't understand, when JMeter sends the request, it would re-encode the " " as
a "+", just like the original request.  Please explain in detail exactly what
the request is supposed to look like and how JMeter is sending and the difference.
creator: mstover1@apache.org
mstover1@apache.org
text:
Until someone explains the problem more, I'm changing the severity to minor. 
I've always been able to record file uploads just fine.

No more information since Mike asked for details, almost 6 months ago. Resolving
as unreproducible.
creator: jsalvata@atg.com
